intro: Adelia retusa, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its slender, succulent stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Adelia retusa is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its fleshy leaves and stems. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
